thread.title: NHL: Anaheim Ducks blanked for third time in four games
thread.title_full: NHL: Anaheim Ducks blanked for third time in four games

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Anaheim Ducks blanked for third time in four games
text:
NHL: Anaheim Ducks blanked for third time in four games Associated Press Posted: 10/16/2015 10:21:00 PM PDT Updated: 10/16/2015 10:21:01 PM PDT FRIDAY'S HIGHLIGHTS Avalanche 3, Ducks 0: Reto Berra made 35 saves for his second career shutout and Nathan MacKinnon scored in the opening minute of Colorado's victory over Anaheim (0-3-1). 
Jack Skille also scored for the Avalanche, which dominated its road opener against the three-time defending Pacific Division champions, who have scored just one goal all season. Blues 4, Canucks 3: Alexander Steen had a goal and an assist and St. Louis won its third straight in holding off Vancouver. Maple Leafs 6, Blue Jackets 3: Leo Komarov scored two late goals and Toronto gave coach Mike Babcock his first victory. Jets 3, Flames 1: Dustin Byfuglien broke a tie with 1:28 remaining to lead Winnipeg over Calgary. Hurricanes 5, Red Wings 3: Eric Staal and Kris Versteeg each had a goal and two assists and Carolina handed Detroit its first loss of the season. 
McLellan to coach in World Cup: Former Sharks coach Todd McLellan, now with Edmonton, has been named head coach of Team North America for the 2016 World Cup of Hockey, which returns in September 2016. 
Lightning: Tampa Bay defenseman Nikita Nesterov has been suspended for two games without pay for boarding Dallas Stars forward Curtis McKenzie. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
